intro: Alsophila humbertiana, commonly known as the Humbert's tree fern, is a species of tree fern native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Cyatheaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, feathery fronds. The plant has a slow growth rate and can reach heights of up to 10 meters in favorable conditions. Its rhizome is thick and fibrous, providing structural support and storing nutrients. Alsophila humbertiana plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, contributing to forest structure and biodiversity.
